Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Shabti of queen Nasalsa
Description: This shabti in green faience was discovered in a pyramid at Nuri. The statuette, which bears the hieroglyphic text of  Chapter 6 from the Book of the Dead, is in the name of Nasalsa, wife of the king Senkamanisken (see E.6097, E.6099, E.6103, E.6109A-B) and mother of the kings Anlamani (see E.6108) and Aspelta (see E.7106A-B). She wears a long wig, crowned by the skin of a vulture. In her hands, she holds a pair of hoes. The left shoulder supportes a small square sack.
